Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 14 and May 28, 2003 be adopted and printed by Council Member Barron.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Barron moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of  May 14, 2003 and May 28, 2003 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Supplemental Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Lee Ann Shelton to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as the architect member of the New York City Art Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Lee Ann Shelton,  New York City Art Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Signe Nielsen to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as the landscape architect member of the New York City Art Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Signe Nielsen,  New York City Art Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Byron Kim to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment as the painter member of the New York City Art Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Byron Kim,  New York City Art Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Alice Aycock to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as the sculptor  member of the New York City Art Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Alice Aycock,  New York City Art Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of James P. Stuckey to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment as a lay member of the New York City Art Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: James P. Stuckey,  New York City Art Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Matthew W. Daus to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his reappointment as a member of the Taxi & Limousine Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 2301 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Matthew W. Daus, Taxi & Limousine Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves which the City, the NYC Transitional Finance Authority, the NYC Municipal Water Finance Authority, the NYS Dormitory Authority and the NYC Health and Hospitals Corporation may soundly incur for capital projects for Fiscal Year 2004 and the ensuing three fiscal years, and the maximum amount of appropriations and expenditures for capital projects which may soundly be made during each fiscal year, pursuant to Section 250 (16) of the NY City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Submitting the certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 122 Mulberry Street, d/b/a Positano Italian Restaurant, Community Board #2 (Application no. 20035259 TCM), shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 122 Mulberry St, Manhattan (20035259TCM)

Items.Title: Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 120 Mulberry Street, Buona Notte, Inc., Community Board #2 (Application no. 20035260 TCM), shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 120 Mulberry St, Manhattan (20035260TCM)

Items.Title: Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 115 Mulberry Street, Fratelli Restaurant, Community Board #2 (Application no. 20035261 TCM), shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 115 Mulberry St, Manhattan (20035261TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Supplemental Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Finance (cont'd)
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing personal income taxes.
Items.MatterName: Increasing personal income taxes.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the discount rate for the prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at 2% per annum for Fiscal Year 2004.
Items.MatterName: Discount rate for the prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at 2% per annum for FY'04.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2004 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax on the parcel is more than $2,750 or where, irrespective of the annual tax, the parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land; and for non-payment of charges for work performed pursuant to orders of the Board of Health or Department of Health and Mental Hygiene.
Items.MatterName: Orders of the Board of Health or Dept of Health, Interest Rates

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax on the parcel, other than a parcel that consists of vacant or unimproved land, is not more than $2,750, be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2003 in the case of any such parcel where the real property taxes are held in escrow and paid to the Commissioner of Finance by a mortgage escrow agent; and 9% per annum in the case of all other such parcels.
Items.MatterName: Interest rate to be charged for FY'04 for non-payment of taxes on real property.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2004 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for any parcel where the annual real estate tax is more than $2,750 or where the real estate taxes are held in escrow and paid to the Commissioner of Finance by a mortgage escrow agent or where the parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land; and 9% per annum in all other cases.
Items.MatterName: Water and Sewer Rents, Interest Rates

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the discount rate to be allowed for prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at two percent (2%) per annum for Fiscal Year 2004, pursuant to Section 1519 of the City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Discount rate for the prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at 2% per annum for FY'04.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate for non-payment of real estate taxes where annual tax is more than $2,750, or vacant or unimproved land; and non-payment of charges for work performed pursuant to orders of the Board of Health or Department of Health be 18 percent (18%) for Fiscal Year 2004.
Items.MatterName: Orders of the Board of Health or Dept of Health, Interest Rates

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting resolution recommending that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2004 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax is not more than $2,750 or where the real property taxes are held in escrow and paid by a mortgage escrow agent be eighteen percent (18%), and nine percent (9%) in all other such parcels.
Items.MatterName: Interest rate to be charged for FY'04 for non-payment of taxes on real property.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2004 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be eighteen percent (18%) where the annual tax on parcel is more than $2,750 or where taxes are held in escrow or where parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land, and nine percent (9%) in all other cases.
Items.MatterName: Water and Sewer Rents, Interest Rates

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation (cont'd)

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Golden, Maltese, Marchi and Velella, S.2564-B, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Cymbrowitz, Ortiz, Pheffer, Seddio, Seminerio and McLaughlin, et al, A.5464-B, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a twenty year retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as investigators by district attorneys' offices".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a twenty year retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as investigators by district attorneys' offices (S.2564-B, A.5464-B)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Paterson, S.5305, and Committee on Rules, A.8701, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey title of certain property to Gus Jenkins ".
Items.MatterName: Reconvey title of certain property to Gus Jenkins (S.5305, A.8701)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez, Padavan and Velella, S.4186-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7163-A, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund".
Items.MatterName: Loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund (S.4186-A /A.7163-A)

Items.Title:
Supplemental Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolution
Resolutions
SUPPLEMENTAL INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the Mayor and the Fire Department of the City of New York to abide by the laws as set forth in the Laws of New York, 2002, Chapter 468, Part A, §3, concerning the full active employment status of James J. Corrigan, William Wren, and Phillip T. Hayes by the Fire Department of the City of New York on September 11, 2001, including their eligibility for all rights and privileges as active duty firefighters.
Items.MatterName: Mayor and the FDNY to abide by the laws as set forth in the Laws of New York, 2002.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring businesses operating within the City to adopt certain educational and security measures to help detect and prevent the proliferation of counterfeit currency during sales transactions.
Items.MatterName: Businesses operating within the City to adopt certain educational & security measures to help detect & prevent the proliferation of counterfeit currency.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Federal Communications Commission to advance the date by which all cell phones must have the technology to provide exact location information when a call is made to 911.
Items.MatterName: Federal Communications Commission to advance the date by which all cell phones must have the technology to provide exact location information when a call is made to 911.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Sampson, S.4347-B, "AN ACT to amend chapter 341 of the laws of 2002, relating to authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Richard Bothwell, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3868, Lots No. 20 and 22 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn also known as 891-895 Mother Gaston Boulevard in the borough of Brooklyn, in relation to identifying the correct former owner of such real property as Carol Ajoku".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Richard Bothwell, Brooklyn (S.4347-B)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating disclosure requirements for health clubs that offer contracts for health club services.
Items.MatterName: Creating disclosure requirements for health clubs that offer contracts for health club services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Occupational Safety and Health Hazard Abatement Board of the New York State Department of Labor to promptly establish strong and enforceable track safety standards to protect transit workers and riders that mirror or exceed the safety standards used by the Federal Railroad Administration.
Items.MatterName: Track safety standards to protect transit workers and riders.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative of the city of New York, in relation to eliminating self-certification of plans submitted to the department of buildings.
Items.MatterName: Eliminating self-certification of plans submitted to DOB.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring review by the landmarks preservation commission before a demolition permit may be issued for any residential dwelling in occupancy group J-2 that is more than seventy-five years old and contains four or fewer dwelling units.
Items.MatterName: Review by the landmarks preservation commission before a demolition permit may be issued for any residential dwelling in occupancy group J-2 that is more than 75 years old and contains 4 or fewer dwelling units.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring notification to community boards and council members of applications for new construction and demolition permits.
Items.MatterName: Requiring notification to CB's and CM's of applications for new construction and demolition permits.

Items.Title: Resolution finding that enactment of Proposed Int. No. 393-A does not have a significant adverse impact on the environment and is consistent with the state environmental quality review act.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Enactment of Proposed Int. No. 393-A does not have a significant adverse impact on the environment.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to eligibility for city-subsidized housing programs.
Items.MatterName: Eligibility for city-subsidized housing programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to attaching development conditions to property dispositions reviewed by the City Council.
Items.MatterName: Attaching development conditions to property dispositions reviewed by the City Council.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to reintroduce and adopt the Breastfeeding Promotion Act.
Items.MatterName: Breastfeeding Promotion Act

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring notification to community boards and council members of applications for new construction and alteration permits within the special clinton district.
Items.MatterName: Requiring notification to CB's and CM's of applications for new construction and alteration permits within the special clinton district.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez, Padavan and Velella, S.4186-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7163-A, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund".
Items.MatterName: Loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund (S.4186-A /A.7163-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting requirements for housing subsidies provided by the city of New York.
Items.MatterName: Reporting requirements for housing subsidies provided by NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to utilize current federal census data in allocating State funding for the Brooklyn Public Library, The New York Public Library and the Queens Borough Public Library.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to utilize current federal census data in allocating State funding for the Brooklyn Public Library, The NY Public Library and the Queens Borough Public Library.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.4179-B, and Committee on Rules, A.8632-B, "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to the enforcement of the prohibition against attaching handbills and other forms of advertisements to windshields and windshield wipers, in the city of New York".
Items.MatterName: Enforcement of the prohibition against attaching handbills and other forms of advertisements to windshields and windshield wipers (S.4179-B, A.8632-B)
